summary: Email from defense attorney Christian Everdell to Judge Nathan transmitting supplemental pretrial motions, memorandum, and exhibits under seal in the U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell case. It is a procedural filing notification.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney at Cohen & Gresser LLP sending supplemental pretrial motions and exhibits under seal to Judge Nathan in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: Nathan
persons.context: Judge presiding over U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell case, receiving supplemental pretrial motions from defense counsel.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Defendant in the criminal case referenced (U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell, S2 20 Cr. 330 (AIN)).

persons.name: Bobbi Sternheim
persons.context: Copied on the email regarding supplemental pretrial motions in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca

events.title: Supplemental Pretrial Motions Filing
events.description: Defense team files supplemental pretrial motions, memorandum, and exhibits under seal in U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

keyFacts: The document is an email from defense attorney Christian Everdell transmitting supplemental pretrial motions under seal in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case.
It indicates ongoing pretrial legal proceedings in May 2021, with the defense team actively filing motions.
The email shows coordination among multiple defense attorneys (Everdell, Sternheim, Pagliuca, Menninger) on Maxwell's legal team.
The correspondence is marked confidential and privileged, highlighting the sensitive nature of the sealed filings.
